title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1626-2.4 - Payment of removal costs by housing authority
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1626-2.4 - Payment of removal costs by housing authority

State Regulations

An authority may pay removal costs, i.e., moving
expenses and one month's rent, of low income families from area or buildings to
be cleared to suitable locations, in such amounts as may be approved by the
commissioner, but in no event more than $200 per family. Commercial tenants may
also be allowed such costs if approved by the commissioner, up to a maximum of
$500. Such payments will be made by check payable to the tenant only. Any
arrears owed to the authority by the tenant will be deducted prior to issuing
the check. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1626-2.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
